marketNews.title: Nickel Price Breaks US$19,000/Ton, Highest in 2024
marketNews.content: Nickel futures for 3 months on the London Metal Exchange increased by +4.1% on Friday (19/4) to the level of 19,326 US dollars per ton, marking the highest level in 2024 and the first time it has broken the 19,000 US dollars per ton level since September 2023. The nickel price itself strengthened by +8.6% WoW last week, with a cumulative increase of +16.4% YTD as of April 22, 2024. Several factors are suspected to be the drivers of the nickel price recently, including: - Trade ban on Russian-made nickel metal products issued by the US and UK governments. With this rule, Russian nickel is no longer traded on the LME and Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME). Russia itself contributes 6% of global refined nickel production. - Delays in the approval of nickel mining RKAB (Work Plan for Mining Operations) in Indonesia, which potentially reduces supply. Indonesia has started implementing the extension of the RKAB validity period from 1 year to 3 years, resulting in permit approval taking longer. - Rumors in the market that Chinese authorities are planning to purchase up to 200 thousand tons of nickel pig iron (NPI) products. The nickel price rally occurred when various parties still expected nickel prices to remain relatively low. In April 2024, ING commodity analyst, Ewa Manthey, predicted that the nickel price would still be suppressed in the short term due to a gloomy macroeconomic outlook and the continuation of global oversupply conditions caused by increased production from Indonesia. Meanwhile, the consensus compiled by Bloomberg projects the average nickel price to be at the level of 17,048 US dollars per ton in 2024. Since the beginning of the year, the average nickel price recorded a level of 16,853 US dollars per ton until April 22, 2024.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The increase in nickel prices after being suppressed to the 15,000 US dollar per ton level at the beginning of 2024 has the potential to impact the increase in Average Selling Price (ASP) enjoyed by nickel producer issuers such as INCO, NCKL, and MBMA. The rise in ASP may lead to an annual increase in revenue, considering that NCKL and MBMA still have significant target annual production increases in 2024. Indonesian nickel producers are also very competitive with lower cost structures. As of 2023, issuers such as INCO and NCKL had cash costs in the range of 10,000 US dollars per ton. If this lower cost structure can be maintained, Indonesian nickel producers can enjoy better profit margins when nickel prices rise, and can continue to survive in situations where nickel prices are weakening. On the closing of the stock exchange on Monday (22/4), a number of nickel producer stocks strengthened, with $NCKL +9.7%, $INCO +0.2%, $ANTM +0.6%, and $MBMA +0.9%.

marketNews.title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Weakening and BI Rate Hike Expectations
marketNews.content: The weakening of the rupiah exchange rate to surpass the 16,000 per US dollar level since last week - marking the lowest exchange rate since April 2020 - increased consensus expectations regarding the possibility of Bank Indonesia raising the BI Rate. 7 out of 22 economists surveyed by Bloomberg predict that Bank Indonesia will raise the BI Rate by 25 bps, while the rest project the BI Rate will remain at 6%. In a separate survey compiled by Reuters, the consensus of economists expects Bank Indonesia to maintain the BI Rate at 6% in the Board of Governors Meeting on April 23-24, 2024. The consensus compiled by Reuters also expects the start of Bank Indonesia's interest rate cuts to be delayed from 2Q24 to 3Q24 in line with the hawkish stance from the Fed.

marketNews.title: Constitutional Court Rejects All Presidential Election Dispute Lawsuits
marketNews.content: The Constitutional Court on Monday (22/4) rejected all lawsuits filed by Anies-Muhaimin and Ganjar-Mahfud to hold a re-election and disqualify Prabowo-Gibran. The Constitutional Court ruled that there was no evidence of systematic fraud and presidential intervention, nor were state bodies, regional officials, and social assistance mobilized to influence the 2024 election.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Trade Balance Surplus Reaches US$4.47 Billion in March 2024
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that Indonesia's trade balance surplus increased to 4.47 billion US dollars in March 2024 (vs. Mar 2023: 2.83 billion US dollars). This result exceeded the consensus expectation which projected a surplus of 1.23 billion US dollars and marked the largest trade balance surplus since February 2023. This result was driven by a more moderate decline in exports (-4.19% YoY) compared to the decline in imports (-12.76% YoY). During 1Q24, Indonesia's trade balance surplused by 7.31 billion US dollars (vs. 1Q23: 12.11 billion US dollars), with exports at -7.25% and imports at -0.10%.

marketNews.title: Draft RKP 2025 Targets Tax Ratio Between 11.2% and 12% of GDP
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the Initial Draft of the 2025 Government Work Plan (RKP) targets the tax revenue ratio (tax ratio) to be in the range of 11.2-12% of GDP, up from realizations in 2022 and 2023 which were at levels of 10.4% and 10.32% respectively. To achieve this target, the government is reportedly planning to form a State Revenue Agency and strengthen tax extensification and supervision over wealthy taxpayers. The RKP itself is the basis for the preparation of the State Budget (APBN).

marketNews.title: Sugar Stock Depletion Threatens Price Increases
marketNews.content: Bisnis and Kontan reported that granulated sugar stock is starting to run thin along with a price increase of +25.3% YoY to the level of 18,050 rupiah per kg as of April 20, 2024. Expert Staff from the Indonesian Sugar Association, Yadi Yusriadi, told Kontan that the depletion of sugar stock is due to delays in sugar imports, as well as the sugar cane milling season not having started yet, which is estimated to only take place in May 2024. The Director General of Domestic Trade at the Ministry of Trade, Isy Karim, stated that national granulated sugar stock still reaches 330,000 tons and is sufficient for the next 1.5-2 months.

tickerNews.title: ACES: Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) +19.9% YoY in March 2024
tickerNews.content: ACES: Ace Hardware Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +19.9% YoY in March 2024 (vs. Feb 2024: +15.3% YoY, Mar 2023: +1.2% YoY), with indicative sales value of 710 billion rupiah. SSSG in March 2024 occurred across all regions, namely Jakarta (+13.5%), Java outside Jakarta (+20.3%), and outside Java (+23.3%). During 3M24, ACES recorded SSSG of +13.2% YoY, with indicative sales value of ~1.98 trillion rupiah. ACES management targets SSSG during 2024 to grow by +7% YoY.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Divests Entire Stake in Ophir Vietnam Block 12W B.V. and Plans Share Buyback
tickerNews.content: MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional announced that it has divested its entire shareholding in Ophir Vietnam Block 12W B.V. to Bitexco Energy Company Limited for an undisclosed amount. Medco Energi CEO, Roberto Lorato, stated that this divestment is in line with MEDC's strategy to actively manage its portfolio through targeted acquisitions and divestments. In addition to asset divestment, MEDC also plans to buy back shares up to 100 million (0.4%) shares with funds up to 200 billion rupiah, implying a maximum buyback price of 2,000 rupiah per share. This plan will be discussed at the GMS on May 30, 2024.

tickerNews.title: BUMN Minister Prepares to Release Up to 20% Stake in BRIS to Strategic Investors
tickerNews.content: BRIS: The Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, stated that his ministry is prepared to release up to 20% of Bank Syariah Indonesia's shares to strategic investors, with the aim of strengthening BRIS's liquidity. The shares to be offered are planned to come from the ownership of Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI). Erick mentioned that his team has conducted a roadshow to Qatar and Europe to meet with potential strategic investors for BRIS. Previously, Reuters reported that Abu Dhabi Islamic Bank was exploring the acquisition of a 15% stake in BRIS from BBRI worth up to 1.1 billion US dollars (~17.8 trillion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: SMRA Marketing Sales Reached IDR 424 Billion in March 2024
tickerNews.content: SMRA: Summarecon Agung recorded marketing sales of 424 billion rupiah (+167% MoM, +15.6% YoY) in March 2024. During 1Q24, marketing sales reached 809 billion rupiah (+23.6% YoY), equivalent to 16.2% of the 2024 target of 5 trillion rupiah. This achievement is better than the realization in 1Q23 which only met 13.1% of the 2023 target of 5 trillion rupiah. The landed house segment still dominates marketing sales with a contribution of 84%, followed by apartments (7%), land lots (7%), and shophouses (3%).

tickerNews.title: BBYB Plans Rights Issue Up to 5 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: BBYB: Bank Neo Commerce plans to hold a rights issue up to 5 billion new shares with a ratio of 100,000,000:41,532,324 and a dilution effect of up to 29.34%. The implementation price has not been announced, while the funds are intended to strengthen the company's capital structure and working capital to finance credit increases and other productive assets. BBYB's controller, PT Akulaku Silvrr Indonesia, and BBYB shareholders holding above 5%, PT Rockcore Financial Technology Co.Ltd, will exercise all their rights. Cum right in the regular market and negotiations on June 20, 2024.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Manages Payout Ratio Expectation for 2023 Dividend
tickerNews.content: SMGR: In an analyst meeting on Monday (22/4), Semen Indonesia management informed that they plan to propose the distribution of the 2023 fiscal year dividend with a payout ratio of around 25-30% at the upcoming GMS. This proposed ratio is lower compared to its historical average of 46% for the 2018-2022 fiscal years and lower than management's guidance at the beginning of the year of 80%. This value indicates a dividend of around 80.4-96.4 rupiah per share or equivalent to a dividend yield of 1.6-1.9% based on SMGR's share price on Monday (22/4) at 5,025 rupiah per share. SMGR management explained that the decrease in the dividend payout ratio is intended to temporarily increase cash levels to mitigate global uncertainty conditions due to geopolitical conflicts.
